alert.note: Alert for Auglaize (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 8:53AM EST until March 06 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following county, Auglaize. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding in numerous locations across the warned area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Wapakoneta, St. Marys, Fort Shawnee, New Bremen, Cridersville, New Knoxville, Waynesfield, Moulton, Buckland, Uniopolis, Fryburg, St. Johns, Kossuth, State Route 116 at State Route 197 and New Hampshire.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
